text: 3) Quick Veg Stir ν Fry (5–7 minutes) How to test with RecipeBrain RecipeBrain — Sample Recipe PDF Ingredients: mixed veggies 2 cups, garlic 3 cloves, soy sauce 1 tsp, pepper, salt, oil 1 tsp. Try these questions in your app after uploading this PDF: Created on 2026-02-14 • Use this file to test your Next.js + RAG project. Steps: high heat; oil + garlic 20s; add veggies; stir 4–5 min; finish with soy + pepper. • “How to make chicken curry with less oil?” • “What are the steps for moong dal chilla?” • “Give a quick veggie stir fry recipe.” This PDF contains a few compact recipes written in a structured way so your RAG pipeline can retrieve • “What’s a post ν workout hydration drink in the PDF?” steps, ingredients, and variations. Try questions like: “How to make chicken curry with less oil?” or “Give a 4) Post ν Workout Hydration: Lemon ν Salt Water high ν protein breakfast option.” Ingredients: water 300 ml, lemon juice 1 tbsp, pinch of salt, optional honey 1 tsp. If the app answers from outside this PDF, tighten your prompt: 'Answer ONLY using context'. Steps: mix and drink chilled. Best after sweating sessions. 1) Chicken Curry (Less Oil Version) Servings: 3–4 • Time: ~35 minutes

ONLY using context'. Steps: mix and drink chilled. Best after sweating sessions. 1) Chicken Curry (Less Oil Version) Servings: 3–4 • Time: ~35 minutes Ingredient Amount Chicken (bone-in or boneless) 500 g Onion (finely sliced) 2 medium Tomato (chopped) 2 medium Ginger-garlic paste 1 tbsp Green chilli 1–2 (optional) Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp Kashmiri chilli powder 1 tsp Coriander powder 2 tsp Garam masala 1/2 tsp Curd / yogurt 3 tbsp Curry leaves + coriander leaves as needed Oil 1 tbsp (max 2 tbsp) Salt to taste Water as needed Steps (low-oil method): 1. Heat a pan on medium. Add 1 tbsp oil . Add onions + a pinch of salt and sauté slowly until golden (this builds flavor without extra oil). 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté 30–45 seconds. Add curry leaves if you have them. 3. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Add turmeric, chilli powder, coriander powder; mix well. 4. Add chicken and stir on high for 2 minutes so it sears and coats with masala. 5. Lower heat. Add yogurt (curd) and mix continuously for 30 seconds to avoid curdling. 6. Add 1/2–3/4 cup water. Cover and simmer 15–20 minutes until chicken is cooked and gravy thickens. 7. Finish with garam masala + coriander leaves. Rest

dd 1/2–3/4 cup water. Cover and simmer 15–20 minutes until chicken is cooked and gravy thickens. 7. Finish with garam masala + coriander leaves. Rest 5 minutes before serving. Tips to reduce oil further: use a non-stick pan, add 2–3 tbsp water while sautéing onions, and avoid deep-frying spices. 2) High ν Protein Breakfast: Moong Dal Chilla Servings: 2 • Time: ~20 minutes (after soaking) Ingredients: soaked moong dal 1 cup, ginger 1 tsp, green chilli optional, cumin 1/2 tsp, salt, water, chopped onion/coriander, oil 1 tsp for pan. Steps: blend dal + spices to batter; pour thin on hot pan; cook both sides; serve with curd or chutney.

Add chicken and stir on high for 2 minutes so it sears and coats with masala. 5. Lower heat. Add yogurt (curd) and mix continuously for 30 seconds to avoid curdling. 6. Add 1/2–3/4 cup water. Cover and simmer 15–20 minutes until chicken is cooked and gravy thickens. 7. Finish with garam masala + coriander leaves. Rest

dd 1/2–3/4 cup water. Cover and simmer 15–20 minutes until chicken is cooked and gravy thickens. 7. Finish with garam masala + coriander leaves. Rest 5 minutes before serving. Tips to reduce oil further: use a non-stick pan, add 2–3 tbsp water while sautéing onions, and avoid deep-frying spices. 2) High ν Protein Breakfast: Moong Dal Chilla Servings: 2 • Time: ~20 minutes (after soaking) Ingredients: soaked moong dal 1 cup, ginger 1 tsp, green chilli optional, cumin 1/2 tsp, salt, water, chopped onion/coriander, oil 1 tsp for pan. Steps: blend dal + spices to batter; pour thin on hot pan; cook both sides; serve with curd or chutney.
